content.description:
Audires ululatusululatus, -us, m.: wailing feminarum, infantum quiritatusquiritatus, -us, m.: crying, clamores 
virorum; alii parentes alii liberos alii coniuges vocibus 
requirebant, vocibus noscitabantnoscito, -are = nosco, -ere; hi suum casum, illi 
suorum miserabanturmiseror, -ari: to lament; erant qui metu mortis mortem 

precarentur.
content.question: In line 2, what does liberos mean?

unit.text: 2: Pliny's Letters: Eruption of Mt. Vesuvius

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
